criteria: Identification of Communicable Diseases and Transmission Methods
descriptions: Does not identify any communicable diseases or methods of transmission.
Identifies at least one communicable disease and one method of transmission with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies one communicable disease and one method of transmission with minor inaccuracies.
Identifies multiple communicable diseases and methods of transmission with some inaccuracies.
Identifies multiple communicable diseases and methods of transmission with only minor inaccuracies.
Accurately identifies multiple communicable diseases and their methods of transmission.
Does not suggest any prevention strategies.
Suggests at least one prevention strategy that is not effective or appropriate.
Suggests at least one prevention strategy, but it is not clearly linked to a specific disease.
Suggests multiple prevention strategies, but some are not effective or clearly explained.
Suggests multiple relevant and effective prevention strategies with minor gaps in explanation.
Suggests multiple relevant and effective prevention strategies, clearly explaining how they prevent transmission.
Demonstrates no understanding of how to apply preventative measures in real-life scenarios.
Demonstrates a limited understanding of how to apply preventative measures in a single, unrealistic scenario.
Demonstrates basic understanding of how to apply preventative measures in one realistic scenario.
Demonstrates a good understanding of how to apply preventative measures in multiple scenarios, but connections are not clearly articulated.
Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of how to apply preventative measures in various scenarios with clear articulation of connections.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of how to apply preventative measures in a wide range of scenarios, analyzing complex connections and potential challenges.
